answer:
The hepatitis A vaccine is not part of the routine immunization schedule for most children in B.C. It has however been offered to Aboriginal children living both on-reserve and off-reserve since January 1, 2012.  If you do not have a record of your child receiving the hepatitis A vaccine, your child would be considered unimmunized against hepatitis A. 
Immunization Nurse

## The hepatitis A vaccine is not part of the routine immunization schedule for most children in B.
C.
 It has however been offered to Aboriginal children living both on-reserve and off-reserve since January 1, 2012.

If you do not have a record of your child receiving the hepatitis A vaccine, your child would be considered unimmunized against hepatitis A.
 
Immunization Nurse
